text: Grevillea crowleyae is a shrub of the genus Grevillea native to an area in the south west corner of the Wheatbelt region of Western Australia. The shrub typically grows to a height of and has non-glaucous branchlets. It has simple flat dissected leaves that are long and wide. The inflorescence is raceme with irregular grey flowers that appear from August to November. It will produce a red-brown hairy oblong fruit that is long. G. crowleyae grows in a disturbed site in Eucalyptus wandoo forest in heavily laterised gravelly loam soil. It will regenerate from seed only. ==See also== * List of Grevillea species ==References== crowleyae Category:Proteales of Australia Category:Eudicots of Western Australia Category:Endemic flora of Western Australia
title: Grevillea crowleyae
